programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A teenage girl passes through the doors of Prestige Pawnbrokers, seeking to sell her grandfather's designer watch in an effort to fund her fledgling jewellery business. History expert Lawrence is delighted when he is presented with an autographed 1960s racing programme, and an online customer is shocked by the valuation received by her collection of luxury items. Plus, boss James Constantinou ends up crashing a converted double-decker bus when he takes it for a test drive.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James Constantinou on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two first-time buyers, beginning with Ian Harker, a vicar about to retire who wants to remain in east London with his wife. They then focus their efforts on businesswoman Shazia Awan, who has built a successful lingerie business and is looking forward to expanding her opportunities by moving from south Wales to London.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. The eatery's decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Newton House in Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, where Denise Carter and Jackie Fennell's traditional B&B focuses on organic, free-range breakfasts. Over dinner, guest Marianne Cammack and Deina Thomas from dominate the conversation, riling up some of the others, while Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson think the morning meal is all way too fancy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Council manager Charlotte hosts the first dinner party in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, where she hopes to impress electrician Steve, occupational nurse Christine, retired French teacher Meic, and teaching assistant Ainsley with an evening that features a former rugby choir as entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Electrician Steve hosts the second night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and hopes that his menu of lasagne, vegetable soup and homemade wine will impress his guests and win him the £1,000 prize. As the evening goes on, Meic decides to bare all with a revelation that shocks Christine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Occupational nurse Christine hosts the third dinner party in Llanelli, where she tries to impress her guests with a menu of family favourites and a performance by her number one rock band. Charlotte and Meic stumble across the host's messy office, and trouble brews when Ainsley tells Christine that she looks like one of her exes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired French teacher Meic hosts the fourth night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and plans an authentic French menu including poulet Basquaise. Fellow diner Charlotte makes an impression when she arrives wearing an onion necklace, and the host hopes that his specially branded cremes brulees will impress his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day of the competition in Llanelli, and the turn of teaching assistant Ainsley to host. She wants to educate her guests, while serving an authentic Russian-themed dinner party. However, vodka-infused pavlova and some dancing may not be enough to offset the cantankerous mood at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of house-hunters. In North Yorkshire, they catch up with Trudi and Steve who relocated from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives, and in Luton, Bedfordshire, the experts find out whether community artist Zena has been able to move out of her parents' home and get onto the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows sun-worshippers Carol and Junior Smith from Middlesex five properties on Spain's popular Mar Menor in the hope one will meet their approval.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer assist two couples in their search for homes in Hertfordshire. Newly engaged accountants Liz and Neil are hoping to raise a family near the town of Tring, while in St Albans, married couple David and Claire want to find a place where they can finally settle down, after moving house five times in five years.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: The Mystery of the Crossrail Skulls
programme.desc: Documentary examining the discovery of dozens of Roman-era skulls by engineers working beneath London's Liverpool Street station. The remains have been identified as dating back to Roman times, but it has yet to be determined who these people were and how their heads ended up buried on the site. Archaeologists examine the bones for evidence of the various theories that have been suggested, questioning whether the skulls belonged to gladiators, executed rebels or the victims of a massacre, or formed part of a grisly ritual.(n)

programme.title: Britain at Low Tide
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and Alex Langlands set out to document Britain's industrial and natural maritime history, using state-of-the-art technology to comb the nation's exposed coastlines during times of low tide. They first head out to the Northumbrian coastline, to investigate the tragic story of a French fishing trawler that was wrecked off shore in 1913.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Holiday Resort
programme.desc: Cameras monitor life at the all-inclusive Holiday World Resort in Malaga on Spain's Costa del Sol to take a warm-hearted look at what Britons get up in the sun and what it takes to keep them happy. Those featured include the Lloyd family from Northampton, including 12-year-old Danny whose singing and dancing proves a hit at the aquafit class. The Wades from Southend-on-Sea, Essex, are hoping to bond via the resort's all-inclusive entertainment - provided the children stop bickering, while James and Leanne from Preston battle the crowds during the morning stampede for the pool.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Thailand to find out if the alarming headlines about additive MSG are justified, Kate Quilton heads deep into the Amazon rainforest to investigate rumours that the brazil nuts on UK supermarket shelves are radioactive and Matt Tebutt reports on a Lincolnshire business producing 1.5 million bottles of elderflower cordial without employing a single flower picker.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Seven new contestants have to work together to win up to £10,000, but one of the jurors starts to rub everyone up the wrong way.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers in London. The programme's youngest-ever house-hunter, 18-year-old student Claire Winship, has had cerebral palsy from birth and uses a wheelchair. With a budget of £1.7million, she wants a property with good investment potential, plenty of accessible space and a view of the Thames. Meanwhile, trainee fashion buyer Geri and her carpenter boyfriend Arran are looking for a one-bedroom flat near Crouch End in north London, and have £280,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Bridgeport, Connecticut, to visit Cafe Tavolini, which is being neglected by husband and wife managers teetering on the edge of divorce. The estranged couple's two children are struggling to save the business from their parents' disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dry-cleaning manager Valerie hosts the first dinner party in Lancashire, where she plans to impress her guests with a lamb hotpot and trifle. However, it remains to be seen whether her warm-hearted hospitality will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize by the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance teacher Nicky hosts the second night in Lancashire, where she hopes to impress her guests with a round-the-world themed menu inspired by her dancing tours, which includes a Chinese salmon starter, and an American dessert. However, with fellow contestant Peggy born in the United States, the host may have her work cut out in presenting the perfect dish.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outsourcing manager Steve hosts the third night in Lancashire, where the 51-year-old plans to wow his guests with a `man of the world' menu that relies heavily on strong Indian spices. Peggy picks him up on his shop-bought black pudding, while Nicky is unimpressed by the mildness of the chicken balti, resulting in a humiliating chilli-sauce challenge.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American Peggy hosts a USA-themed dinner party on the fourth night of the competition in Lancashire, and hopes her Arizonan recipes will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize. Her menu comprises tried and tested dishes, including her dessert of peach dump cake. However, friction between her and fellow contestant Steve continues to build.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Lancashire, and the turn of sales manager Andy to host. He is confident in his locally sourced gastro menu and delivers a meal with plenty of flair, but faces the challenge of impressing foodie Nicky. He is also under pressure to convince American Peggy of the merits of the region's food, while his fellow Lancastrians Valerie and Steve are keen to see how the area has influenced his cooking.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Single mother Jo Beck wants to move her family to Derby, despite her children being happily settled in Nottingham. Phil Spencer helps her decide if relocating is the right choice and searches for a suitable home. Also in Derby, Kirstie Allsopp offers advice to outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John Fairfield, who are looking for a property with a large garden, storage space for their sporting equipment and no noise from nearby roads.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: New series. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, Steve Jones and Kate Quilton host an appeal running every night until Friday as they embark on a quest to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage people to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part and the team will be helping would-be pet owners find their perfect playmate. In the first edition, singer Leona Lewis shares her love of giving shelter animals a second chance in life.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Alcorn family in Peebles in the Scottish Borders. The family of four lives in a conservation area and while dad Dave loves their grey-stone Victorian villa for its picture-book charm, mum Amy despises its lack of practicality. With no off-road parking, no third bedroom and no downstairs bathroom - not to mention the small, draughty kitchen - she has quite a list. Would it be best to simply move on to one of the new properties picked out by Phil, or can Kirstie come up with a way of making their home work?.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping

Meanwhile, Hyde amazes everyone by finding a rich girlfriend, and Red catches Bob in a compromising position. Starring Mila Kunis, Ashton Kutcher and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.sub-title: Out with the Old, In with the New.

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jay goes to help her injured mother recuperate, leaving Michael in charge of the house and kids - who take advantage of the opportunity to behave badly. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Cate sets off to attend a seminar, while Bridget is accused of shoplifting at a local chemist's and finds her picture has been exhibited for all to see on a public `wall of shame'.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.desc: Drag queens Vida, Noxeema and Chi Chi win a trip to Hollywood. But on their cross-country road trip, they're stranded in a small town where they fall foul of the local redneck cop, give out free fashion advice and help battered wife Carol Ann(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: When meek Eilis Lacey (Saoirse Ronan) emigrates from Ireland to New York City, her heart is soon torn between a magnetic Italian neighbor (Emory Cohen) and a charming lad (Domhnall Gleeson) back home(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: Richard Pryor stars as Montgomery Brewster, a low-league baseball player who suddenly finds out that a distant relative has left him $300m. But there's a catch he has to waste $30m in just 30 days without anyone knowing he's doing it, without investing it and without banking it. And his best friend John Candy is no help, trying to make his friend's money earn interest... Walter Hill, better known for tough dramas, turns his hand to comedy for this much-loved and filmed stage play, scripted in this case by Timothy Harris and Herschel Weingrod of Trading Places fame(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: An ancient assassin attempts to trounce an evil conqueror by teaming up with a coalition of the remaining "free tribes" surviving under tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Hard-nosed army sergeant Tom Highway battles rebellious recruits and his own strait-laced superiors in the build-up to America's invasion of Grenada(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic spanning a twenty-year period in the life of eccentric millionaire Howard Hughes, including the films, the women and his pioneering success as a world-class aviator. Visually stunning drama(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Courtroom drama in which two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Winter's Tale
programme.desc: In early-20th century New York, a thief falls for a dying heiress, but he is being pursued by a vengeful enemy(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Romantic melodrama about a young woman who begins a new relationship with a different man each month in order to help them develop into more compassionate individuals. However, there are unexpected repercussions for both parties when she attempts to bring meaning to the life of a hard-hearted, career-centred business executive(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Robert Aldrich's tense and exciting thriller about air crash survivors who are finally forced to try and build a single-engine aircraft from the wreckage of their plane in order to escape from their crash-site in the north African desert(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: In this hilarious fish-out-of-water comedy, two Puerto Rican NYC cops are asked by a pair of French fashion designers to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Rock Star
programme.desc: Drama about a wannabe rock star who works by day as a copy machine repairman and by night as the lead singer of Blood Pollution, a Pennsylvania tribute band that imitates the heavy metal rockers Steel Dragon. He is devastated when his friends kick him out of the group he founded, but things begin to look up when he is tipped to replace the lead singer of his heavy metal idols. Based on the true story of rock band Judas Priest(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Kyle Reese is assigned to protect Sarah Conor from an unstoppable cyborg sent back from the future to terminate the mother of resistance leader John Connor(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession - a 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: A desperate mother seeks the help of a pair of priests, when her angelic daughter becomes possessed by a terrible demon. Horror(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: The director of the Academy Award-winning 2006 crime drama Tsotsi returns to the helm with this tale of a Middle East CIA operative who begins to have doubts about his latest assignment after witnessing the interrogation of a suspected suicide bomber by secret police. When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi (Omar Metwally) mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella (Reese Witherspoon), embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst (Jake Gyllenhaal) arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment. Peter Sarsgaard, Meryl Streep, and Alan Arkin co-star in this topical political thriller penned by Kelley Sane and produced by Steve Golin(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Jason Statham leads the cast of this high-octane action-thriller set in the post-industrial wasteland of tomorrow, with the world's most brutal sporting event as its backdrop. A penitentiary full of felons has inspired the jailers to create a grisly pastime ripe for lucrative kickbacks. Now, adrenalised inmates, a global audience hungry for televised violence and a spectacular arena come together to form the Death Race. From expert action director Paul W.S. Anderson and the producers of Mission: Impossible comes Death Race! The stakes don't get any higher than this!(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate an attack on a nurse, and discover she had been moving house regularly in an effort to evade a stalker who terrorised her with distressing e-mails. The victim regains consciousness, but fails to identify her attacker, leading to the shocking revelation that she may have fabricated the assault story as a way of attracting attention.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY

Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A blind man unwittingly photographs evidence of a murder, leading Jethro and the team to the corpse of a petty officer who was stabbed with a knife left at the scene. Further evidence indicates his death was not the result of a random mugging - but cracking the case proves difficult. Meanwhile, Tony has relationship problems. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is made acting director while Jenny is attending an overseas conference. However, he decides to ignore his duties and investigate the murder of a man who arrived dead in a taxi at the team's headquarters with no clues to his identity - except a mysterious list of names. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.desc: A millionaire former CIA man meets a premature end when someone plants a controlled explosive in his lighter. Over the years he had built up an impressive list of enemies, so finding his killer looks like an uphill task, but as the agents start working through the potential culprits, a recovered computer file leads them to an escort service used by a wanted hitman. However, what they don't bank on is the chief suspect turning up dead.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The body of a pregnant woman is found in a burnt-out building, triggering an investigation that leads the team to suspect a wealthy coffee trader and his son may be responsible. Drama, starring Adam Beach, Ice-T and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: Set in 1607, it tells of the beautiful, brave and compassionate daughter of Chief Powhatan who speaks to her forest friends (Meeko the raccoon, Flit the hummingbird and Grandmother Willow, a 400 year old spirit that resides in an ancient tree) for advice. It tells how her life changes when she meets John Smith, one of a party of sailors which has come to the New World searching for gold. The powerful and moving story of a Native American princess and her ill-fated love for an English sea captain, Pocahontas is a stunning piece of state of the art animation. Pocahontas teaches him the true value of life, and how every rock tree and creature has a living spirit. She saves him from execution by her people, and he in turn saves Powahatan but is wounded. Eventually they are forced to part, but their spirits remain entwined. This beautiful and moving story, enhanced by a superb soundtrack, make Disney's 33rd animated feature film an unmissable gem(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: The supernatural tale of star-crossed lovers continues as the Cullen family flees Forks in order to protect Bella (Kristen Stewart), and the heartbroken high-school senior discovers that vampires aren't the only creatures in town. Realizing that Bella will never be safe as long as he's around, Edward (Robert Pattinson) makes the difficult decision to leave his beloved behind shortly after her 18th birthday. Reeling from her loss, Bella embraces self-destruction after being comforted by Edward's image during a moment of mortal peril. But as heavy-hearted as Bella may be, her old friend Jacob (Taylor Lautner) distracts her from her sorrows by helping her renovate a weather-beaten motorbike. When Bella encounters a former adversary with a sizable grudge, she's rescued from harm at the last second by pack of enormous, ferocious wolves. Subsequently delving into the history of the Quileutes, Bella discovers the secrets of Jacob's tribe while looking forward to a reunion with Edward that may have deadly consequences(n)

programme.title: Rachael Ray
programme.desc: Assembled for television by Oprah Winfrey's production company, the daily, hour-long talkfest Rachael Ray starred the former host of several Food Network programs, the author of several best-selling cookbooks, and the maven of many a popular franchised cooking product. At first glance, Rachael Ray may have seemed to be yet another Martha Stewart clone, but a closer examination revealed that Ray preferred to have a looser and more spontaneous format on her series than was seen on Martha's; also, though she certainly dispensed some cooking and housekeeping tips here and there, she did not confine herself to these domestic pursuit. The set of Rachael Ray was designed by the hostess herself as a "home away from home", complete with stove and plush chairs. Most of the guests on the series were specialized experts whom Ray had met and befriended during her previous TV life on the Food Network. Rachael Ray was first syndicated the week of September 18, 2006 by King World Productions(n)

Romero's Land of the Dead."(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: Stallone is back for the fourth time (as Rocky) when an invincible computer-trained Soviet boxer kills his friend in a one-sided bout. Rocky must get ready for one more impossible bout against a clobbering cluck who probably couldn't get his own grandma to root for him. Even though there is probably never any real doubt as to the outcome, this film will likely have viewers on their chairs' edges one more time(n)

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: When a group of missionary aid workers in Myanmar disappear into the vast green inferno, vigilante Vietnam War veteran John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) leaves his job as a Salween River boatman behind to accompany a group of mercenaries on a daring rescue mission. It's been 20 years since Rambo helped mujahedeen rebels fend off Soviet invaders in Afghanistan, and these days the former soldier lives a simple life in northern Thailand. Meanwhile, the world's longest-running civil war rages into its 60th year on the nearby Thai-Burma border. One day, human rights missionaries Sarah Miller (Julie Benz) and Michael Burnett (Paul Schulze) show up asking Rambo to guide them up the Salween so they can get some much-needed food and medical supplies to the desperate Karen tribe. According to Sarah and Michael, the Burmese military has planted land mines all along the roads leading into the tribe's village, making it virtually impossible to reach the tribe via land. Two weeks after Rambo drops the group off in dangerous territory, pastor Arthur Marsh (Ken Howard) arrives with a chilling message: the aid workers never returned from their mission into the jungle, and the embassies refuse to help Marsh and his fellow missionaries find their missing friends. Now, despite the fact that Rambo has long since sworn off all forms of violence, the knowledge that innocent missionaries are being used as pawns in a brutal war leaves him with no other choice than to venture behind enemy lines on his most dangerous mission to date(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: After being nominated seven times to the Oscars, Martin Scorsese won the Best Director statuette for this crime thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson and Mark Wahlberg, among other stars. Billy Costigan is a police officer assigned to work undercover with Irish mobster Frank Costello to get evidences to arrest him. On the other side, Colin Sullivan, the informer of Costello, is promoted in the Massachusetts State Police. The Departed also received the Best Picture Academy Award(n)

programme.title: Marked for Death
programme.desc: A retired DEA agent takes down a Jamaican drug gang that has overrun his hometown(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: British ship captain and his crew battle a French vessel during the Napoleonic Wars. Eventually, the pursuit leads the two ships on an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. Billy Connolly is a howl as a zombie who's been domesticated to do work around a suburban couple's home, where he befriends their young son. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)

programme.title: Incarnate
programme.desc: An unconventional exorcist must use his psychic abilities to do battle with a malevolent demon that has taken over an innocent 11-year-old boy. Later, he learns that the paranormal entity is also responsible for the deaths of his wife and child(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: This direct-to-DVD sequel features Rob Lowe as an Iraq War veteran whose past comes back to haunt him in Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming. Upon returning home from the line of duty, National Guard Captain Ted Cogan thought his life would go back to normal, until he started seeing visions of a group of innocent bystanders he inadvertently killed in Iraq. With his family on the brink of destruction, Ted turns to a psychic that aids him in understanding what needs to be done to put these restless souls at peace - even if it means giving up his own life(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: Two mismatched security guards are thrown together to bust a smuggling operation(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: In this hilarious fish-out-of-water comedy, two Puerto Rican NYC cops are asked by a pair of French fashion designers to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the Far East, Alex O'Connell, the son of famed mummy fighters Rick and Evy O'Connell, unearths the mummy of the first Emperor of Qin -- a shape-shifting entity cursed by a witch centuries ago(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: William The Exorcist Friedkin's horror film stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a violent conspiracy theory which sees them become violently delusional to the point of extreme self-harm as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: High-octane action thriller about a cop who goes undercover in Los Angeles's street-racing world in order to snare the villainous leader of a gang(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: Two mismatched security guards are thrown together to bust a smuggling operation(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: In this offbeat love story, a woman falls for an oddly principled hit man who kills anyone who hires him to commit murder. While she believes she's finally found the perfect guy, their romance is threatened by an FBI agent who's hunting her new beau(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: A portrait of an irreverent Armed Forces Radio deejay in Saigon during the Vietnam War(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin scores as a hip secret agent in this hilarious spoof of blaxploitation flicks, directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Griffin's character works for a black spy organization that's battling "The Man" and his efforts to suppress black culture. Denise Richards costars as White She-Devil. Chris Kattan, Dave Chappelle(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore, Cameron Diaz, and Lucy Liu return alongside director McG for the sequel Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle. In this adventure, the Angels are assigned by Charlie to track down a pair of missing rings encoded with the names of every federal witness in the government's protection and relocation program. The women employ all of the skills seen in the first film in order to stop the bad guys (and bad girls). Bill Murray declined to appear in the sequel. The role of Bosley has been taken over by Bernie Mac. Demi Moore rounds out the cast of this big-budget spectacle(n)

programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this film adaptation of the popular video-game series(n)

programme.title: San Quentin: Inside the Big House
programme.desc: An inside look at San Quentin State Prison in California includes the history and construction of the buildings, which include a manufacturing facility, classrooms, exercise facilities and a hospital for the nearly 6000 inmates(n)

programme.title: Waco Standoff: As We Watched
programme.desc: A chronicle of the 1993 siege of the Branch Davidian religious group's compound near Waco, Texas, by federal and state law-enforcement agencies that culminated in a fire that took 76 lives(n)

programme.title: Manson: The Prison Tapes
programme.desc: The Tate/LaBianca murders are spotlighted, featuring archival footage and reports and a look at the media circus surrounding the trials of cult leader Charles Manson and his "family" of misfit killers(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Arsenal
programme.desc: Against All Odds. General Custer's last moments are recorded in a hastily written note; a submarine is sent to destroy a train; a battle-worn flag is a symbol of betrayal; the Old West becomes a worldwide sensation(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Arsenal
programme.desc: Smoking Guns. History buff Geoff Edgers travels throughout the US in search of little known stories highlighting the heroism of individuals in extraordinary circumstances(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Arsenal
programme.desc: Heroes. Stories of heroism include accolades for a train robbery; a general's plans for World War II; and a prediction of Bonnie and Clyde's death(n)

programme.title: Ancient Assassins
programme.desc: The Pope's Bodyguards. The Pontifical Swiss Guard defend Pope Clement VII during the Sack of Rome in 1527 by mutinous troops of Holy Roman Emperor Charles V(n)

programme.title: Ancient Assassins
programme.desc: Medieval Mercenaries. English mercenary Sir John Hawkwood makes a name for himself in 14th-century Italy by serving a variety of sponsors, including Pope Gregory XI in the War of the Eight Saints(n)

programme.title: Ancient Assassins
programme.desc: Viking Apocalypse. A 9th-century conflict between English monarch Alfred the Great and invading Vikings is recalled(n)

programme.title: Ancient Assassins
programme.desc: Vlad's Impalers. The Season 2 premiere focuses on Vlad "The Impaler" Tepes, a 15th-century Romanian prince, and the legends of mass murder against his enemies and his own people. Tepes was the inspiration for Bram Stoker's novel "Dracula."(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: A New Germany (1933-1939). Laurence Olivier narrates the acclaimed documentary series. Stricken by the humiliation of defeat, Germany looks to Adolf Hitler for a resurgence of hope(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). While the full force of the Nazi war machine sweeps across Europe, an uneasy calm settles on Britain(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). Laurence Olivier narrates the acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II. Despite having the largest pre-war European army, France's outdated forces were humilated by the Germans. Identifying a weakness in the Maginot Line, a defensive border which ran along the north east of France but did not extend to the channel in the west, German air and armour power simply skirted the line in the north and forged south(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). Acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II, narrated by Laurence Olivier. With France fallen, the USA as yet uninvolved and the Russian pact with Hitler still in force, Britain stands all alone against the Germans forces across the English Channel(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Barbarossa (June - December 1941). Hitler turns his tanks towards Russia. After a succession of victories, the Germans delay fatally(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Banzai!: Japan (1931-1942). Japan enters the war. Footage traces conditions in Japan during the '30s and "government by assassination." Also on film: extremists capture Manchuria, and China is invaded; at Nanking, 200,000 Chinese are massacred; Russia repels attacks on its Manchurian border; Japan heads south for the oil wells in the Dutch East Indies. Guam, Wake Island, Hong Kong, Manila and Borneo fall, following the attack on Pearl Harbor. Laurence Olivier is the series narrator(n)

Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.desc: Linda returns to the Square and throws herself into getting everything back on track, while a nervous Mick toys with the idea of confessing everything that went on with Whitney. Abi confronts Steven for ignoring her, but he assures her it is all part of his plan for them to be together - although Max ensures the young man feels awkward as he discusses his wedding plans with Lauren. Keanu desperately searches for a job and schoolteacher Mr Pryce looks at flats in the area.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the women's 1500m final. Great Britain's Laura Muir will hope to be involved, but could face the likes of Olympic champion Faith Kipyegon and world record-holder Genzebe Dibala. Another Briton who will hope to contend for a medal this evening is 110m hurdler Andrew Pozzi, while the women's triple jump final also takes place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba and Phil Jones.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got Old News for You

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Emma Willis is the latest to take part in the popular genealogy documentary, in which famous faces trace their family trees. The TV presenter, who considers herself a true Brummie, is keen to learn more about her family in Birmingham, tracing back to Victorian times and her hard-working ancestor James Gretton, a local merchant. The Big Brother host then learns that her father's grandmother was born in Ireland. Surprised to hear of this new line of ancestry, Emma heads across to Dublin to find out more - but she is disturbed by what she learns.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: A glimpse at the rarely seen South American wilderness, home to a range of creatures from terrain as varied as the Andes to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Will Axon travel through East Sussex in their search for bargains, beginning in Hastings before battling it out at auction in Lewes. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Four - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the final of the women's hammer throw. Team GB's Sophie Hitchon made history last summer by becoming the first British woman to win an Olympic medal in this event, and she will be hoping to become Britain's first-ever World Championships hammer medallist, male or female. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba. Coverage continues on BBC1.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain samples what London has to offer, heading to Beckton in the east of the city to visit an indoor urban farm in an industrial estate that uses hydroponics and aquaponics to rear fish and grow vegetables. She then heads north to Holloway, to meet chef Pratap Chatal, who runs supper clubs in his home where he showcases his revolutionary idea of cooking his food with fragrances.(n)

programme.title: Man in an Orange Shirt
programme.desc: In the present day, Flora finds her demons return when her vet grandson Adam tentatively forms a relationship with his client Steve, but a minefield of internalised issues and dangerous temptations still line the road to the happiness of them all. When the discovery of a lost painting by Thomas March brings things to a head, can Flora reconcile her past with her grandson's future? And is Adam brave enough to choose love? Concluding part of Patrick Gale's drama, starring Vanessa Redgrave, Julian Morris and David Gyasi.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where four finals took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Coming Oot! The Fabulous History of Gay Scotland
programme.desc: Documentary using eyewitness testimony, archive footage and historical research to examine the post-war history of Scotland's gay community, charting the Scottish public's radically changing attitudes over the past 70 years. Scotland was over a decade behind England and Wales in decriminalising homosexuality but now has the best gay rights in Europe: nothing short of a revolution.(n)

programme.title: Is It Safe to Be Gay in the UK
programme.desc: With homophobic hate crime a daily occurrence and on the rise in the UK, this film takes a look at the issue, and tells the stories of the victims, their families and the police that deal with the attacks. To explore the ongoing issue, this film hears from a chorus of LGBT victims who recall their experiences, and discuss how they dealt with such unprovoked attacks, simply for being who they are.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: John Sweeney investigates what is going on at the top of the charity, following the chief executive's sudden resignation in June. John meets people who accuse the RSPCA of being heavy handed by prosecuting them and taking away their animals when help or advice would have been more appropriate, and meets former senior insiders, who have concerns about the charity's governing council.(n)

programme.title: Kirsty Wark: The Menopause and Me
programme.desc: The Newsnight presenter sets out to answer the most common questions about the menopause, cutting through the confusion and confronting the taboo aspects of this very personal subject. The programme features frank and often funny testimony from famous and not-so-famous women, including Jennifer Saunders and Kaye Adams, and there is advice from experts including Dr Heather Currie, the Chair of the British Menopause Society. Kirsty also investigates ground-breaking research at Edinburgh University - research that has the potential to extend women's fertility.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace, Cherry Healey and Ruth Goodman investigate the origins and production of more household staples, beginning with tea. Gregg looks at the factory that produces one quarter of all the tea drunk in Britain. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey examines an African tea processing plant, and Ruth Goodman sheds light on how Second World War troops risked their lives to brew up.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Sherlock and Mr Selfridge actress Amanda Abbington joins host Brian Conley to look back at the classic television shows that shaped her into the person she is today. She reflects on how watching her favourite children's programmes alongside her mother gave her a chance to showcase her talent for accents, and confesses that she cannot bring herself to watch horror films when husband and fellow actor Martin Freeman is away from home.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Jean Johansson tries to get the Siberian tigers to cool off in their pool, Kate Humble finds out why Longleat's pelican expert has won a major award and Ben Fogle meets some lemurs.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt help two teams buy three items at Wetherby Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles also visits one of the world's oldest sweet shops.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating inspirational agricultural families and the events where they showcase their hard work. Dairy farmers Ben and Holly from Eynsford, Kent, come up against neighbour and friend Trevor from Guston at the Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show in Surrey.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Judy Murray - mother of British number one tennis player Andy - as the programme continues its Wimbledon-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores some of the most spectacular and scary sea cliffs in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the opening Super 8 and Qualifier fixtures, including Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors and Castleford Tigers v St Helens.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Somerset, where Brian rustles up a grilled wild boar fillet with roasted beetroot and cumin at the county's highest point - Dunkery Beacon. Janet explores the three eras of landscape gardening at Hestercombe Gardens, including the design collaboration of Edward Lutyens and Gertrude Jekyll. Local chef Brett Sutton serves up local lamb and black garlic, before the presenters visit the Haynes International Motor Museum. Plus, Brian prepares the celebration dish of baked apples with cider caramel sauce.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: The documentary offering a glimpse into the rarely seen South American wilderness continues, this time following the path of the relentless wind sweeping east through Patagonia's dry desert from the Andes' peaks. The programme reveals a weird world of maras - a large relative of the guinea pig - and penguins, and witnesses the first faltering steps of baby guanacos - Patagonia's very own camels. Cameras also observe the people who have taken on this inhospitable environment and carved out a home for themselves. Santiago Cabrera narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Will Axon travel through Kent in their search for bargains, beginning in Bilsington before battling it out at auction in Sandwich. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the fifth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the finals of five events. Injury had prevented David Rudisha from defending his 800m but a high-quality race is still expected, while world record-holder Wayde van Niekerk is the man to beat in the 400m final. Medals are also decided in the women's javelin, and men's 3000m steeplechase and pole vault. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Jimmy Carr and the Science of Laughter - A Horizon Special.
programme.desc: The comedian takes over the science programme in a special episode for BBC's sitcom season, turning it into a chat show with eminent scientists as guests. He talks to them about the nature of laughter, with the studio audiences serving as guinea pigs in his attempt to get to the bottom of what laughter is, what it has to do with comedy, and why human beings find it a pleasurable sensation. The programme reveals that laughter predates the human species and may have played a vital role in our evolution.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe turns his attention to the Reaper, the biggest sailing lugger ever to fish the seas at 70ft long, and capable of pulling in 10 tons of herring in a single haul. He learns about the origins and history of the vessel, which played an important role in supplying food to Britain after the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Tornado: The 100mph Steam Engine
programme.desc: Cameras following the fortunes of new A1 class steam engine Tornado as it tries to achieve 100mph on the main line, a secret attempt made in the middle of the night.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: Cameras follow one of the world's most famous locomotives as it returns to the tracks following a 10-year restoration that cost more than £4 million. Enthusiasts and supporters are aboard as the train sets off from London's King's Cross Station on a journey to York and its new home at the National Railway Museum. John Shrapnel narrates.(n)

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores the history of the Norse warriors, delving into their customs and searching for the truth behind their fearsome reputation. He begins by telling the story of their origins, and investigates the world of their ancient ancestors. The programme charts Scandinavia's prehistoric landscape, from the Baltic Sea to Norway's Atlantic coast, and Neil examines archaeological evidence to create a portrait of the society from which the Vikings emerged.(n)

programme.title: Nelson's Caribbean Hell-Hole: An Eighteenth Century Navy Graveyard Uncovered
programme.desc: After the discovery of human bones on a beach in Antigua, historian Sam Willis investigates one of the darkest chapters of Britain's imperial past. As archaeologists excavate a mass grave of British soldiers, he explores the island's ruins and discovers how the sugar islands of the Caribbean were rife with sun, sea, war, tropical diseases and poisoned rum.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Sensibility: The Allure of Art Nouveau
programme.desc: Stephen Smith examines the influence art nouveau had on British art and design in the early part of the 20th century. He explores the work of illustrator Aubrey Beardsley and architect and designer Charles Rennie Mackintosh, as well as delving into the careers of less celebrated figures, including Mackintosh's wife Margaret MacDonald and artist and craftswoman Mary Watts. Smith also considers how entrepreneur Arthur Liberty helped popularise the art nouveau style through his London department store.(n)

programme.title: Carved with Love: The Genius of British Woodwork
programme.desc: Paul Copley narrates the story of Grinling Gibbons, the 17th-century woodcarver who helped restore London to its former glory in the aftermath of the Great Fire. He reveals how Gibbons' masterpieces - created for the likes of Charles II and William of Orange - were held in such high regard he came to be known as `the Michelangelo of wood'.(n)

programme.title: Tornado: The 100mph Steam Engine
programme.desc: Cameras following the fortunes of new A1 class steam engine Tornado as it tries to achieve 100mph on the main line, a secret attempt made in the middle of the night.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: Cameras follow one of the world's most famous locomotives as it returns to the tracks following a 10-year restoration that cost more than £4 million. Enthusiasts and supporters are aboard as the train sets off from London's King's Cross Station on a journey to York and its new home at the National Railway Museum. John Shrapnel narrates.(n)

programme.desc: After the discovery of human bones on a beach in Antigua, historian Sam Willis investigates one of the darkest chapters of Britain's imperial past. As archaeologists excavate a mass grave of British soldiers, he explores the island's ruins and discovers how the sugar islands of the Caribbean were rife with sun, sea, war, tropical diseases and poisoned rum.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe profiles the Bristol Channel pilot cutter, the design of which many sailors consider to be the perfect combination of form and function, and ideally suited to crossing one of Britain's most treacherous stretches of water.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.desc: New series. Art historian Professor Richard Clay explores how the idea of utopia has been re-invented by generations of writers and artists. He also examines what utopian visions reveal about our deepest hopes, dreams and fears. Among the contrributors is Star Trek actress Nichelle Nichols.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Immortal? A Horizon Guide to Ageing.
programme.desc: Veteran presenter Johnny Ball looks back over the years that both he and TV series Horizon have been appearing on air to find out what scientists have learnt about how and why people grow old. He charts developments from macabre early claims of rejuvenation to the latest breakthroughs, and asks if the dream of immortality is any closer to coming true.(n)

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: Neuroscientist David Eagleman takes viewers on a journey into the inner workings of the human brain, revealing how it affects thoughts, actions and beliefs.(n)

programme.title: Bundesliga: Games of the Season

programme.desc: We revisit October's goal-laden epic between Ingolstadt and Borussia Dortmund at Audi Sportpark. This incident-packed clash featured a dramatic last-gasp goal.(n)

programme.title: Serie A: Games of the Season
