programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spanish Chest.
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery.(n)

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: David realises he may have his work cut out proving his innocence when even his wife Robyn turns against him, while Pete receives another blow when he arrives at work to see Harry. Jen is taken to task by her sister Sheila over the care of their elderly mother and Karen steps her relationship with Eddie up a notch, but a visit from a desperate David threatens her plans, and Adam faces problems when his wife becomes increasingly distant. Comedy drama, starring John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads an investigation into a kennel suspected of housing more than 50 ill-treated dogs.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen seizes some emaciated horses that were forced to eat dirt to survive. Two of the mares have foals and are struggling to produce milk to feed them.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Allison Foy, who went missing in July 2006 after drinks with friends at a bar in North Carolina. Investigators contemplated whether the 34-year-old was trying to escape her stormy marriage or abducted by a predator. The mystery of her disappearance ended two years later when her remains were found in woodland close by the body of another murder victim, but no one was detained in connection with her death.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Crimes by the sorts of people seldom suspected, such as those with respectable jobs. Their often shocking white collar misdeeds prove a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The case of airline co-pilot Andreas Lubitz, who seemingly deliberately crashed a German airliner into the French Alps, killing all 150 passengers on the flight.(n)

programme.title: Judge Jeanine Pirro
programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Investigators discover a woman was stalked and murdered for her casino winnings when her decomposed body is found a month after her abduction.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Officers find themselves having to reassemble a computer disk cut up with pinking shears in order to solve a brutal murder case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tiny pieces of plastic - the size of grains of sand - provide police with clues after a bombing in which a man was killed.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A college student is murdered on her way home from work, while a Michigan woman disappears after accepting her dream job.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: A case from January 1996, when on the morning after the Super Bowl final, a campus worker at Tustin High School in Orange County, California discovered the body of 24-year-old Thien Minh Ly on the tennis court.(n)

programme.title: Murder Shift
programme.desc: A man is shot dead in Indianapolis, and witness accounts conflict regarding several cars spotted at the scene, leaving detectives hunting for clues.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Officers find themselves having to reassemble a computer disk cut up with pinking shears in order to solve a brutal murder case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tiny pieces of plastic - the size of grains of sand - provide police with clues after a bombing in which a man was killed.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The murder of 25-year-old Holly Notestine, whose body was found deep in a logging forest with 17 stab wounds in 2000. Joseph Clark lost 100 pounds before his trial eight years after the death, but jurors still believed he was the `big fat man' who abducted and killed the Bedford County victim.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Edith McLeroy, who rebelled against her conservative upbringing in Alabama by marrying the leader of a biker crew. Her tethered body was retrieved from marshes in 1980, but it took 30 years until the mystery of her death was resolved.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Sins
programme.desc: How after winning his first election, a politician's lust for power turned to murderous envy that had deadly repercussions. Plus, a small-town funeral home that set the stage for death, with unbridled lust, and cold-blooded murder.(n)

programme.title: Murder Among Friends
programme.desc: A case in which a man was found murdered in a cemetery. It was suggested his death was a ritual sacrifice, leaving police to expose the black magic and satanic rituals involved.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old car dealer Christopher O'Brien, who in February 1992 took a man for a test drive and never returned to his Long Island premises. Officers contemplated whether O'Brien's criminal past finally had caught up with him.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: A case in which two distraught women called emergency services to report finding their sister murdered. Detectives hunted a killer driven by self-hatred.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Walsenburg, Colorado, in which a frantic emergency telephone call to help a neighbour ended in a bizarre investigation, complete with a twisted tale of torture and family secrets.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old car dealer Christopher O'Brien, who in February 1992 took a man for a test drive and never returned to his Long Island premises. Officers contemplated whether O'Brien's criminal past finally had caught up with him.(n)

programme.title: Scene of the Crime with Tony Harris
programme.desc: The mysterious case of Jeff Bradstreet, a doctor known for unusual autism treatments. His death was ruled a suicide, but the presenter contemplates whether it was more sinister.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before an old tip led detectives out of state to find their man.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists reconstruct the scene of a bludgeoning in Georgia, USA, in an attempt to track down the suspect in a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The animal protection officers have cause to investigate a breeder.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Patricia Viola, who vanished from her New Jersey home in February 2001, shortly after a routine telephone conversation with her mother. A bone fragment was found locally just over a year later, but it would be a another decade until DNA advancements allowed its identity to be positively confirmed after comparisons were made with samples provided by Viola's two children.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: How University of Virginia lacrosse player George Huguely's drinking binge leds to a deadly encounter with his ex-girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Crimes by the sorts of people seldom suspected, such as those with respectable jobs. Their often shocking white collar misdeeds prove a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How stepbrothers Jamie McMahan and Chris Kauffman, responsible for a murder and robbery spree, were tracked down in Florida following a TV appeal for information.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The death of an Air Force Officer's wife appears to be a tragic accident, but closer inspection of the scene reveals more sinister circumstances.(n)

programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to piece together the stories of soldiers who went to war but never returned.(n)

programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.(n)

programme.desc: The 1991 fatal shooting of cashier Tammy Petrin at a burger house in Woonsocket, Rhode Island. After lead suspects were discounted, a prostitute and prison letters provided detectives with vital clues citing her imprisoned husband's involvement in the case. It transpired Ronald Harnois hired two of his ex-fellow inmates to kill Tammy so she couldn't testify against him in an upcoming trial.(n)

programme.sub-title: Match Day Review: v Real Madrid 2016/17.
programme.desc: All the reaction, including exclusive interviews with the manager and players after this weekend's game.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Times Guesthouse in Ipswich, where mother-and-daughter duo Linda and Kelly Langdown hope a go-karting session will get the contest off to a flying start. However, a lack of breakfast options and corner-cutting on the guests' orders do not go down very well.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit the Flower Pot in Sunbury-on-Thames on their second night, where owner Simon Bailey and French manager Pierre Cudon provide stylish continental-inspired accommodation, but the hosts are left puzzled by some of the feedback they receive the next morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the family-run Dolphin Hotel in Exmouth, Devon, which has been a life's work for hotelier Jo Knowles. On arrival, Pat and Nigel find a suspicious stain, before the guests put on their war faces for a game of paintball. Jo takes everyone to a floating restaurant for dinner, and the next morning she presents a huge spread for breakfast - but her diners are suspicious that it has been laid on specially for the competition.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants stay at the Mariners Beachside B&B in Seaton, Devon, but are disappointed by the cleanliness of the property. They take part in a town-crying competition during the afternoon, and host Nigel feels under pressure to deliver his award-winning breakfast the next morning. Come feedback time, the owners discover not all their guests share the same opinion.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid, and confront their rivals. Simon Bailey and Pierre Cudon from the Flower Pot feel the feedback left by Nigel and Pat Booth is a step too far, while the Mariners B&B owners hit back at the men's opinion of their establishment's cleanliness. Linda and Kelly Langdown of the Old Times Guest House question the rating of their facilities, while the Dolphin Hotel's Jo Knowles has a confession to make regarding her hosting.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and Mick Aston lead a team investigating the history of Westminster Abbey, battling London's driving rain as they seek to uncover the truth about one of Britain's greatest landmarks. They hope to locate a lost sacristy, rumoured to have held the largest treasure trove to the west of the Alps, but are surprised to find the remains of a row of 18th-century houses and workshops built right up against the Abbey.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: An invitation to excavate the remains of what is thought to be one of Scotland's earliest chapels on the Isle of Mull provides Tony Robinson and the team with one of their biggest, most rewarding, challenges. In a forest outside the town of Tobermory, they believe they have discovered a settlement established by St Columba, who brought Christianity to northern Britain - but the remoteness of the location and the discovery of human remains threaten what could be a once-in-a-lifetime find.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: A cat with severe breathing problems and a two-year-old Shar Pei dog that has been abandoned and has an eye disease that could eventually blind it if not treated.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a man who drunkenly bought a 1920s showman's carriage online, but quickly sobered up when he saw the poor condition it was in. He also visits a holiday home constructed from a Second World War vehicle, faces a major setback with his caravan project and follows the build of a beach hut - in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: Scientists use the latest forensic techniques to investigate bizarre landscapes in America, Iceland and the floor of the English Channel that might have been caused by huge floods.(n)

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: How It Happened
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the scientific factors behind the magnitude nine earthquake and the resultant tsunami that struck Japan on March 11, 2011. Professor of geological sciences Roger Bilham views the effects of the devastation from the air, and journalist Callum Macrae travels to the north of the country, where survivors in the fishing villages of Sendai and Ofunato are struggling to cope in the aftermath.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Will is concerned about potential spinal and head injuries when 63-year-old Valerie is rushed to St George's after falling from a horse, while 30-year-old Natasha has had an accident while trampolining at her son Taelan's eighth birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: Scientists use the latest forensic techniques to investigate bizarre landscapes in America, Iceland and the floor of the English Channel that might have been caused by huge floods.(n)

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: How It Happened
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the scientific factors behind the magnitude nine earthquake and the resultant tsunami that struck Japan on March 11, 2011. Professor of geological sciences Roger Bilham views the effects of the devastation from the air, and journalist Callum Macrae travels to the north of the country, where survivors in the fishing villages of Sendai and Ofunato are struggling to cope in the aftermath.(n)

The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Tim Westwood, Lauren Laverne, David O'Doherty and Matthew Crosby join host Jimmy Carr for an extended edition of the irreverent panel show in which teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to help model agency boss Susan Mitchell and her friend Sara Minton find their dream holiday home in Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The expert archaeologists search a stretch of the River Tees for Roman artefacts thought to have come from one of the most impressive forts in northern Britain. They find buildings and roads that confirm its importance as a major strategic crossing close to the Scottish border and Hadrian's Wall, but are surprised to discover it was also the location of three Roman bridges - and perhaps another from prehistoric times. Tony Robinson presents.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Norman Cross, Cambridgeshire: Death and Dominoes - The First PoW Camp.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate the site of the world's first purpose-built PoW camp, which was constructed to incarcerate 7,000 of Napoleon's troops in 1797 at Norman Cross in Cambridgeshire. The team is particularly interested in locating the cemetery where more than 2,000 inmates were buried after dying from diseases contracted in the camp - and their search leads them to discover how degraded prisoners' lives could be.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Professional dog-walker Sandy asks Scott Miller to give her a first-aid lesson in case anything happens to her charges, while S Club 7 star Hannah Spearritt also visits the clinic.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a man whose simple plan of converting a shipping container into a garden office has proved rather more difficult than expected, and visits a canal boat that has been cleverly redesigned as the ultimate bachelor pad. He's also finally ready to unveil his own small-space project as he completes his mission to transform a caravan into a holiday home.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The team tackles a dining room using a fusion theme called Rustic Bohemian, Robin Johnson tries block printing and low-cost lamp making, and Ant Anstead blows glass bottles.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In the Lakes, farmer Pip hatches a plan to prevent the problem of lost sheep, and in the Dales, cameras follow the Dent Brewery boys as they make and distribute their craft ales.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Tracks with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The historian explores the UK's network of ancient trackways and roads, which have been walked by pilgrims, hunters and invaders over the course of the past 5,000 years, each one shrouded in myth, mystery and legend. In the first episode, Tony delves into the stories, songs and sacred places along the Icknield Way in Norfolk and Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: When Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Panic in Paradise. In April of 2008, the popular tourist destination of Zihuatanejo Mexico is transformed from a safe haven of crystal clear water into one of the most dangerous beaches in the world. The area has never seen a shark attack in its history, but when three surfers are violently attacked, two of them fatally, in less than a month, the town erupts into a panic. As the attacks escalate and the towns vital tourism flounders, the terrified public wonders why the normally safe waters have turned into a blood soaked nightmare? and what will happen to their town if the attacks continue. Its up to scientists to investigate the mysterious attacks and explain whats going on before the town collapses? or the waters claim another victim(n)

programme.desc: Though the ocean covers roughly three-quarters of planet Earth's surface, not even the world's top scientists and explorers can tell us exactly what we'd find if we were somehow able to take a stroll at the bottom of the sea. programme.desc: She slices through the waters surface with explosive power. Sail, spear, and a half ton of muscle flash in the sun. Now, Wild Logic travels the oceans of the world to reveal the secrets of the billfish(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life

programme.title: The Flash

programme.title: The Flash

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

Fantasy drama, starring Stephen Amell.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Teenager Logan starts work as an apprentice deck-hand, while landlady Pat recalls fond memories from her life in Brixham.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. CJ is interviewed by White House counsel, Donna asks Josh for a job and Santos questions his choice of Leo as running mate. Martin Sheen and Bradley Whitford star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A grand jury is convened to investigate the military shuttle leak, and Vinick is in charge of smoothing things over as the campaign's focus switches to national security. Santos, however, is forced to distance himself from events while remaining loyal to the administration. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for a recently blinded girl and her mobility instructor, who were abducted during a camping trip. Jack's wife tells him she wants a divorce, and Vivian takes over as supervisor. Starring Anthony LaPaglia and Marianne Jean-Baptiste.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A breakthrough is made in the case of the miniatures killer when the team discovers who Ernie Dell was trying to protect. However, a replica crime scene left in Grissom's office suggests one unlucky member of the CSI team is scheduled to be the next victim - and may already be dead. Crime drama, starring William Petersen.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes across New York City when seemingly unconnected people are affected by the same recurring incident. It is up to Danny to discover what the victims have in common and who is responsible. Meanwhile, Frank helps an old friend come to terms with his alcoholism. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Three weeks into the presidential campaign, Santos pulls off a coup that raises his approval ratings, while Vinick ignores warnings of a possible assassination brought to him by an eager NSA agent. The pair compete to bring each other down as they deliver their messages of the week. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: When his peace plan for the Middle East is jeopardised by the assassination of a Palestinian leader, President Bartlet insists on attending the funeral despite concerns over his security. Meanwhile, CJ receives disturbing news from a member of the intelligence community. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Allison Janney.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A hospital worker disappears on a quiet rural road while changing a flat tyre, and the detectives' investigation reveals she is wanted in connection with the bombing of an abortion clinic. Meanwhile, the missing woman's husband goes into hiding and Jack returns to assist the team, creating conflict with Vivian, who has assumed command in his absence. Anthony LaPaglia, Poppy Montgomery and Marianne Jean-Baptiste star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Still stunned by the revelation of Grissom's love for the abducted Sara, the team combs the desert for her. Unfortunately time is running out as heavy rain heads toward the area - and Natalie the miniatures killer cannot or will not help.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The body of a devoutly religious woman is found in a cemetery and Danny's investigation reveals that she was murdered. programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Lured to New York City to investigate a series of strange drug overdoses, the FBI profilers are right where The Replicator wants them. They try to turn the tables by learning more about the killer, but events take a dramatic twist that leads them to suspect their enemy is one of their own. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

However, he soon discovers his opinions render him incapable of relating to the superficial personalities he is expected to work with, not to mention his egotistical boss. Comedy based on Toby Young's memoirs, starring Simon Pegg, Kirsten Dunst, Jeff Bridges, Megan Fox and Gillian Anderson.(n)

Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

Comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Michael Gambon, Charles Dance, Kellie Bright, Martin Freeman and Rhona Mitra.(n)

Comedy, with Bam Margera, Henry Rollins, Spike Jonze and Tony Hawk.(n)

Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: A mad scientist kidnaps a beagle to use as a guinea pig in his deranged experiments. But an accidental injection leaves the mutt with awe-inspiring superpowers, which he uses to foil the deranged inventor's plans to take over a city. Comedy adventure, starring Peter Dinklage and James Belushi, and featuring the voices of Jason Lee and Amy Adams.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: My Favorite Martian
programme.desc: A TV journalist meets a stranded alien who is trying to repair his crashed spacecraft. After first planning to exploit the chance of a big story, he instead offers his help after befriending the visitor - but a fellow reporter plans to expose the truth. Sci-fi comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Elizabeth Hurley and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: The Strongest Man in the World
programme.desc: A student and his friends discover a formula that, when mixed with breakfast cereal, gives them superhuman strength. However, it is not long before their breakthrough is noticed by the criminal fraternity and a motley assortment of crooks are after the secret. Disney comedy, starring Kurt Russell, Eve Arden, Joe Flynn, Cesar Romero and Phil Silvers.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An Antarctic scientific expedition has to be aborted when a blizzard hits, forcing their guide to leave behind his team of huskies in the frozen wilderness. He is determined to return and rescue the animals, but in the meantime, the dogs have to rely on pack instinct alone to ensure their survival in the hostile climate. Disney adventure, starring Paul Walker, Bruce Greenwood and Jason Biggs.(n)

programme.title: Green Zone
programme.desc: A military officer is sent to Iraq after the downfall of Saddam Hussein on a mission to find the weapons of mass destruction that were used to justify the invasion - only to be warned by a CIA agent that no such devices exist. As he continues his fruitless search, he discovers evidence of a political conspiracy. Paul Greengrass's thriller, starring Matt Damon, Greg Kinnear and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: I Am Wrath
programme.desc: A grieving widower is shocked when his wife's killers manage to evade justice, so he seeks the aid of an old friend in taking the law into his own hands. However, as he hunts down the murderers, he discovers they have friends in very high places. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: The amnesiac assassin is living quietly in hiding, until his former employers come after him again and murder his girlfriend. A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three highly skilled fighter pilots are less than thrilled when a new computer with artificial intelligence is brought in to assist in flying a state-of-the-art jet. However, the trio are left to pick up the pieces when the machine is struck by lightning and begins to malfunction, leading to a chaotic battle to stop the jet from starting an all-out war. Action adventure, starring Jamie Foxx, Jessica Biel and Josh Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: World heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Balboa settles down into a life of luxury - but a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of ambitious contender Clubber Lang, whose brutal fighting style represents a serious threat to his title. Drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Mr T, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers and Hulk Hogan.(n)

programme.title: Green Zone
programme.desc: A military officer is sent to Iraq after the downfall of Saddam Hussein on a mission to find the weapons of mass destruction that were used to justify the invasion - only to be warned by a CIA agent that no such devices exist. As he continues his fruitless search, he discovers evidence of a political conspiracy. Paul Greengrass's thriller, starring Matt Damon, Greg Kinnear and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: The amnesiac assassin is living quietly in hiding, until his former employers come after him again and murder his girlfriend. A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Underworld: Evolution
programme.desc: Vampire warrior Selene and her lover, a hybrid creature, must flee for their lives from the eldest of her kind. The ancient bloodsucker plans to find and release his imprisoned brother, the first ever werewolf, but Selene knows the creature will simply destroy everything in its path and must fight to destroy both of them. Action fantasy sequel, starring Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman and Derek Jacobi.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds
programme.desc: A New Orleans detective's girlfriend is kidnapped by a vengeful criminal mastermind, who sets him a sadistic challenge. To save her, the cop must successfully complete a series of 12 death-defying challenges that send him on a dangerous race through the city. Action thriller, with John Cena, Aidan Gillen and Ashley Scott.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Secret agents suspect there is a traitor in their organisation when their latest assignment ends in disaster. The sole survivor is accused of being the mole, forcing him to go on the run to clear his name. However, in the process, he discovers a former Russian spy is selling information about the world's leading undercover operatives. Action thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Ving Rhames.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Amnesiac rogue assassin Jason Bourne's long-buried memories are reawakened by a British journalist researching the secret organisation that was responsible for transforming him into a killing machine. Meanwhile, a ruthless CIA director becomes convinced Bourne is still a security risk, and plans to dispose of him once and for all. Third instalment of the spy thriller series, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, Joan Allen, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Paddy Considine, Scott Glenn and Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of genetically engineered clones bred to be the perfect assassin takes on a mission that strikes close to home. A corporation intends to use the technology that created him to build an army of superhuman killers. As the assassin fights to bring them down, he uncovers the dark secrets surrounding his origin. Action thriller, starring Rupert Friend, Hannah Ware and Zachary Quinto.(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion agrees to help former champion Apollo Creed train for a match against a seemingly invincible boxer from the Soviet Union, only to see his friend die as a result of injuries sustained in the fight. Rocky vows to avenge him, and prepares to take on the Russian heavyweight in his own country. Drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Dolph Lundgren, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers and Brigitte Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: A reconnaissance pilot is shot down and becomes stranded in enemy territory after filming evidence of a genocidal massacre by Serb militia in Bosnia. The naval air commander for Nato forces in the Balkans defies orders by mounting an unauthorised mission to rescue him, while the airman faces a battle to stay alive as he is pursued by paramilitary forces. Bosnian War drama, starring Gene Hackman, Owen Wilson, Gabriel Macht and Olek Krupa.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Secret agents suspect there is a traitor in their organisation when their latest assignment ends in disaster. The sole survivor is accused of being the mole, forcing him to go on the run to clear his name. However, in the process, he discovers a former Russian spy is selling information about the world's leading undercover operatives. Action thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Ving Rhames.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Amnesiac rogue assassin Jason Bourne's long-buried memories are reawakened by a British journalist researching the secret organisation that was responsible for transforming him into a killing machine. Meanwhile, a ruthless CIA director becomes convinced Bourne is still a security risk, and plans to dispose of him once and for all. Third instalment of the spy thriller series, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, Joan Allen, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Paddy Considine, Scott Glenn and Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: Blood Orange
programme.desc: Ageing rock star Bill receives a visit from Lucas, the ex-lover of his younger wife Isabelle, who demands she give him an inheritance he claims she has denied him. Bill invites Lucas to stay, hoping to make peace between them, but Lucas has a plan to get revenge, and manipulates the pool boy into helping him. Thriller, starring Iggy Pop and Kacey Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Enemy of the State
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet.(n)

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl.(n)

programme.title: Get Rich or Die Tryin
programme.desc: An inner-city drug dealer puts his life of crime behind him after a near-fatal shooting to pursue a new career as a rap artist. Unfortunately, when he performs songs inspired by his shady past, his former criminal associates do not take kindly to having their misdeeds immortalised in music. Drama, starring Curtis `50 Cent' Jackson, Terrence Howard and Ashley Walters.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: The Man from UNCLE
programme.desc: A CIA agent is forced into an uneasy alliance with his arch-rival in the KGB at the height of the Cold War. A criminal organisation is planning to alter the balance of power by making nuclear weapons widely available, and the two spies must work together to foil the plan. Action adventure based on the 1960s TV series, starring Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander and Hugh Grant.(n)

programme.title: Get Rich or Die Tryin
programme.desc: An inner-city drug dealer puts his life of crime behind him after a near-fatal shooting to pursue a new career as a rap artist. Unfortunately, when he performs songs inspired by his shady past, his former criminal associates do not take kindly to having their misdeeds immortalised in music. Drama, starring Curtis `50 Cent' Jackson, Terrence Howard and Ashley Walters.(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two mismatched FBI agents, one a tough former sheriff, the other a by-the-book idealist, are sent to a small town in the Deep South to investigate the disappearance of three civil rights activists, only to come up against a conspiracy of silence. Alan Parker's drama set in the 1960s, starring Gene Hackman, Willem Dafoe, Brad Dourif, Michael Rooker, R Lee Ermey and Frances McDormand.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Sisters
programme.desc: Two sisters tire of their mother's alcoholism and a string of her abusive boyfriends, and plot to kill her. Thriller, starring Abigail Breslin, Georgie Henley and Mira Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A seven-year-old girl witnesses the murder of her mother and sisters, and testifies that her teenage brother was the killer, leading to his imprisonment. As an adult, she attends a gathering of true-crime fans, and discovers they all think her brother was innocent. She reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime, and begins to realise her memories may not be as reliable as she thought. Mystery, starring Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks and Chloe Grace Moretz.(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman.(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas.(n)

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.(n)

programme.title: Dog Eat Dog
programme.desc: Premiere. A crew of former prisoners are hired by a Cleveland crime syndicate to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook.(n)

programme.title: Niagara
programme.desc: Polly and Ray are on honeymoon at Niagara Falls where they meet George and Rose, whose own marriage is falling apart. Polly later discovers that the brazen and alluring Rose has a lover waiting in the shadows and they are scheming to kill the emotionally unstable George - but the newlywed is unable to convince anyone of the danger as the murder plot edges toward a tragic conclusion. Thriller, with Marilyn Monroe, Joseph Cotten and Jean Peters.(n)

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: A cockney lothario leads a charmed life, enjoying casual sex with as many women as possible with no thought of the consequences. However, a series of unexpected setbacks forces him to finally take stock of his life. Comedy drama based on the play by Bill Naughton, starring Michael Caine, Jane Asher, Millicent Martin, Shirley Anne Field, Shelley Winters and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Closer to the Moon
programme.desc: Five high-ranking members of the Communist party in 1950s Romania rob a bank and very nearly get away with the crime. When they are finally arrested, they are sentenced to death - but before their execution, they are ordered to re-enact the heist on film, so it can be used in a propaganda movie. Fact-based comedy crime drama, starring Mark Strong and Vera Farmiga.(n)

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: A radio DJ contemplates suicide after a listener embarks on a murderous rampage in response to one of his broadcasts. He is saved by a now-homeless former professor of medieval history, who encourages him to retrieve what he claims is the Holy Grail. When the DJ later learns that he is responsible for his saviour's misfortunes, he feels compelled to make amends. Terry Gilliam's comedy drama, with Robin Williams, Jeff Bridges, Amanda Plummer and Mercedes Ruehl.(n)

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: A determined salesman takes custody of his five-year-old son when his wife leaves him, and secures an unpaid internship with a renowned stockbroking firm. However, the lack of a steady income begins to take its toll on the pair, leading to eviction from their home and a daily struggle to support themselves. Gabriele Muccino's fact-based drama, starring Will Smith alongside his son Jaden. With Thandie Newton, Brian Howe, James Karen, Dan Castellaneta and Kurt Fuller.(n)

programme.title: The Prince of Tides
programme.desc: An American football coach travels to New York hoping to untangle his sister's troubled life aftetr she tries to kill herself. He forms a close relationship with her psychiatrist, who helps him to come to terms with the terrible secrets of his childhood. Romantic drama based on the novel by Pat Conroy, directed by and starring Barbra Streisand. With Nick Nolte, Blythe Danner and Kate Nelligan.(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: Fathers and Daughters
programme.desc: A writer still recovering from the death of his wife struggles to retain custody of his daughter as he develops a serious illness. Years later, his daughter is now an adult and faces up to the personal issues brought about by her chaotic childhood as she begins a new relationship. Drama, starring Russell Crowe and Amanda Seyfried.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: An aristocratic Englishwoman inherits a vast cattle station in the Australian Outback in the 1930s. When her land comes under threat from a rival farmer aiming to build a monopoly, she is forced to lead her herd across the wilderness to secure the farm's future, falling for a tough stock-man and forming a friendship with a half-Aboriginal boy along the way. However, as they make their journey, the country becomes drawn into the Second World War. Baz Luhrmann's romantic drama, starring Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: Confetti
programme.desc: Three couples compete for the title of Most Original Wedding of the Year, with a film crew following the preparations. Theatre-loving Matt and Sam plan a musical marriage, naturists Michael and Joanna brave the elements for their all-nude nuptials, while fiercely competitive Josef and Isabelle warm up for a sporty ceremony. Spoof documentary, starring Martin Freeman, Jessica Hynes, Robert Webb, Olivia Colman, Stephen Mangan and Meredith MacNeill.(n)

programme.title: Bus Stop
programme.desc: A cafe singer is romantically pursued by a love-struck rodeo cowboy who is determined to win her hand in marriage - if only by persistence alone. Comedy drama, starring Marilyn Monroe and Don Murray, with Betty Field and Arthur O'Connell.(n)

programme.title: How to Steal a Million
programme.desc: A woman hires a burglar to steal one of her grandfather's forged sculptures from a prestigious Paris museum before it can be exposed publicly as a fake, unaware the man is actually a detective investigating the family. However, the cop suffers a crisis of conscience when he finds himself falling for the woman. Crime comedy, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter O'Toole, Charles Boyer, Eli Wallach and Hugh Griffith.(n)

programme.title: Cool Hand Luke
programme.desc: A rebellious small-time crook is sent to a prison in the Deep South, where he becomes a hero in the eyes of his fellow convicts and a thorn in the sides of the warden and the guards by refusing to bow to authority. His defiance escalates when he receives news of his mother's death, and embarks on a series of failed escape attempts. Drama based on Donn Pearce's novel, starring Paul Newman, George Kennedy, JD Cannon and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Jane Wants a Boyfriend
programme.desc: A young woman with Asperger's syndrome decides to enter the dating scene despite the concerns of her well-meaning older sister. Romantic comedy drama, starring Louisa Krause and Eliza Dushku.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: Lively teenager Bianca is not allowed to start dating until her man-hating sister Kat does first - but no boy is brave enough to ask her out. However, Bianca's would-be boyfriend thinks he has found the perfect man for the job in the shape of a quirky loner with a mysterious past. Comedy, based on Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew, starring Heath Ledger, Julia Stiles, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

programme.title: A Mighty Heart
programme.desc: Drama based on journalist Mariane Pearl's account of her husband Daniel's kidnapping and murder by a militant group. Mariane was pregnant when she travelled with him to Pakistan. When he disappeared without trace, the frantic search for him turned into a media frenzy. Starring Angelina Jolie, Dan Futterman and Archie Panjabi.(n)

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: A man is unaware his uneventful life is really a sham, and his every move is being secretly filmed and broadcast to the world as part of a 24-hour TV soap. However, a series of unforeseen events leads him to question the nature of his existence. Peter Weir's media satire, starring Jim Carrey, Natascha McElhone, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: Frankie & Alice
programme.desc: Premiere. A black dancer develops multiple personality disorder, with one of her alter egos an angry white racist from the Deep South. With the help of a psychiatrist, she delves into her past in the hope of identifying the childhood trauma that has caused her condition. Fact-based drama, starring Halle Berry and Stellan Skarsgard.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneer Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair.(n)

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: A Warrior's Tail
programme.desc: A boy escapes when his village comes under attack by a pack of hyenas, and goes to get help. He meets a magical white wolf, who leads him on a journey in search of a magician who can help them find a powerful warrior - but many danger's lie between them and the sorcerer's mountain home. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Milla Jovovich, Whoopi Goldberg and Sharon Stone.(n)

programme.title: Cars 3: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at Pixar's latest animated adventure, featuring the voices of Owen Wilson and Armie Hammer.(n)

programme.title: Snoopy and Charlie Brown: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The long-suffering youngster hopes his lifelong run of bad luck will come to an end when he develops a crush on a new schoolfriend. His beloved dog has more important things to worry about, as he dreams of taking to the skies in his airborne kennel. Animated comedy, with the voices of Noah Schnapp and Bill Melendez.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Musical remake, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.(n)

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A troubled teenager moves to a tough inner-city school after her mother's death, but struggles to settle into her vastly different life - until a new boyfriend helps her discover a fresh sense of purpose through the power of dance. Romantic drama, starring Julia Stiles, Sean Patrick Thomas and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. programme.title: Inside Out: Special
programme.desc: The making of the Pixar animation, taking viewers inside the mind of a youngster as she copes with the emotional upheaval of moving to a new town and new school.(n)

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the latest trip into JK Rowling's wizarding world, including interviews with stars Eddie Redmayne and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: A gifted youngster is packed off by her selfish parents to the prison-like Crunchem Hall School. Once there, she befriends a sweet-natured teacher who convinces her that not all grown-ups are bad - and urges her to use her special powers to turn the tables on the nasty headmistress. Fantasy comedy, adapted from the children's book by Roald Dahl, with Mara Wilson, Pam Ferris, Embeth Davidtz, Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: When animals start mysteriously disappearing, three young Inuits embark on a perilous journey to save their tribe from ruin. Animated adventure, with the voice of Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

programme.title: Rock Dog
programme.desc: A wide-eyed hound leaves his village home to pursue his rock star dream in the big city. Animated family adventure, featuring the voices of Luke Wilson, Eddie Izzard and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: Adult Beginners
programme.desc: Premiere. An entrepreneur on the brink of success instead loses everything when the product he launches is a failure, prompting his friends to turn their backs on him. He retreats to the safety of his sister's home, where he is allowed to stay on the condition he helps look after her three-year-old son. Despite his haphazard attitude to childcare, he forms a close relationship with his nephew. Comedy drama, starring Nick Kroll, Rose Byrne and Bobby Cannavale.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: Premiere. Animated adventure about a world where storks now deliver everything but babies, until an office mishap that is. With the voices of Andy Samberg, Kelsey Grammer and Katie Crown.(n)

programme.title: Salt and Fire
programme.desc: Premiere. Scientists investigating rare geological formations in Bolivia are abducted by a rogue businessman. Eco-thriller from director Werner Herzog, starring Michael Shannon, Veronica Ferres and Gael Garcia Bernal.(n)

programme.title: Blood Father
programme.desc: Premiere. An ex-con battles to protect his estranged daughter from the cronies of her cartel member ex. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Erin Moriarty and Diego Luna.(n)

programme.desc: Premiere. During the 1980s, a chameleonic US agent faces one of the most dangerous assignments of his life when he infiltrates the intricate criminal network of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo and Diane Kruger.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine
programme.desc: Fifty years in the future, Earth faces extinction, so a spacecraft sets out to reignite the sun with an experimental nuclear device. The crew intercepts a message from a previous ship, which disappeared - but the unexpected contact sets off a dangerous chain of events. Danny Boyle's sci-fi thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Chris Evans, Michelle Yeoh and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: A sideshow performer is taken in by a scientist, who seeks his help in performing experiments to create life, and hopefully uncover the secrets of immortality. The plan goes dangerously out of control, and it falls to the devoted assistant to save his master from his dark obsessions and his monstrous creation. Gothic horror, starring James McAvoy and Daniel Radcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension
programme.desc: A man moves into a new house along with his wife, daughter and younger brother, and finds an old camcorder and a box of videotapes. The siblings start watching the tapes, which turn out to be home movies shot by the property's previous owners, but by doing so, they unleash evil spirits into the world. Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw.(n)

programme.desc: A stormtrooper fighting for an evil regime turns against his masters. He joins forces with a desert scavenger, and together they are drawn into the search for legendary war hero Luke Skywalker, who disappeared years previously. Meanwhile, a terrible weapon is about to be unleashed, that will allow the forces of evil to dominate the galaxy once again. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Harrison Ford and Adam Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Thing
programme.desc: A mysterious shape-shifting alien kills and impersonates its victims on an Antarctic research base manned by a crew of American scientists. The researchers face the ordeal of stopping the creature from making its way to civilisation - but are in danger of jeopardising the task as mounting paranoia turns them against each other. John Carpenter's sci-fi horror remake, starring Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, TK Carter, Keith David and Richard Dysart.(n)
